latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 72.

item.title: Thomasina E. Jordan Indian Tribes of Virginia Federal Recognition Act of 2009

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 174 (Roll no. 295). (text: CR H6099)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 174 (Roll no. 295).(text: CR H6099)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H6100)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 490.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6099-6101)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 61.

General debate for both bills is limited to 1 hour equally divided and controlled. For H.R. 1385, specified amendments are in order. For each bill, the previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except one motion to recommit with or without instructions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-131, by Mr. Cardoza.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-131, by Mr. Cardoza.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 31) to provide for the recognition of the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1385) to extend Federal recognition to the Chickahominy Indian Tribe, the Chickahominy Indian Tribe-Eastern Division, the Upper Mattaponi Tribe, the Rappahannock Tribe, Inc., the Monacan Indian Nation, and the Nansemond Indian Tribe.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 31) to provide for the recognition of the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1385) to extend Federal recognition to the Chickahominy Indian Tribe, the Chickahominy Indian Tribe-Eastern Division, the Upper Mattaponi Tribe, the Rappahannock Tribe, Inc., the Monacan Indian Nation, and the Nansemond Indian Tribe.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
